intro: Rochelia squarrosa, commonly known as the squarrose rochefera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its distinctive, branched inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its small white or yellowish flowers are arranged in umbels, and it produces small, dry fruits. Rochelia squarrosa is often found in coastal areas and is considered a rare and endemic species in some parts of its range.
